extendedIngredients.name: jicama
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 4-oz. piece jicama (peeled) or 1 small cucumber (peeled and seeded), cut into 2-inch-long sticks

extendedIngredients.name: kale
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 bunches kale (1 lb.), stems removed, leaves torn into bite-size pieces

extendedIngredients.name: orange bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 medium orange bell pepper, cut into thin strips

extendedIngredients.name: tofu
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 6-oz. pkg. Thai-flavored baked tofu, cut crosswise into â…›-inch-thick strips

extendedIngredients.name: yellow wax beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 oz. green or yellow wax beans, cut in half crosswise

extendedIngredients.name: sambal oelek
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tsp. sambal oelek, or other fresh chile paste

recipes.title: Asian Kale, Green Bean, and Tofu Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Salad. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. You could try Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: 1. Place beans and 1/4 cup water in skillet, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cover, and cook 3 minutes, or until beans are just tender. Drain, and rinse under cold water to cool. Drain again.2. Toss together beans, kale, bell pepper, and jicama in large bowl.3. Whisk together oil, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, and sambal oelek in separate bowl. Season with salt and pepper, if desired. Pour dressing over salad, and toss to coat.4. Evenly divide salad among 4 bowls, and gently set tofu strips on each salad.

steps.step: Place beans and 1/4 cup water in skillet, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cover, and cook 3 minutes, or until beans are just tender.
Drain, and rinse under cold water to cool.
Drain again.2. Toss together beans, kale, bell pepper, and jicama in large bowl.3.
Whisk together oil, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, and sambal oelek in separate bowl. Season with salt and pepper, if desired.
Pour dressing over salad, and toss to coat.4. Evenly divide salad among 4 bowls, and gently set tofu strips on each salad.
